statement.p: Pollsters are concerned about declining levels of cooperation among persons contacted in surveys. A pollster contacts 80 people in the 18-21 age bracket and finds that 68 of them respond and 12 refuse to respond. When 267 people in the 22-29 age bracket are contacted, 246 respond and 21 refuse to respond. Assume that 1 of the 347 people is randomly selected. Find the probability of getting someone in the 18-21 age bracket OR someone who refused to respond.
Report the answer as a percent rounded to one decimal place accuracy. You need not enter the "" symbol.
